availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Martin V. Maynard (Wayne County, WV, farmer, dry goods merchant, and soldier)

body.p: Wayne County, West Virginia, farmer, dry goods merchant, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of George Maynard and Martha Maynard. Married to Nancy A. Whitt Maynard. Father of George F. Maynard and Jessie W. Maynard. Farmer in Wayne County in 1850. Dry goods merchant in Wayne County in 1860. Farmer in Wayne County in 1863. Served in 167th Virginia Militia as lieutenant in 1862.

Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, West Virginia, Wayne County, Lincoln Township, p. 72A.
Special Schedules of the Eleventh Census (1890) Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Union Veterans of the Civil War, Series M123, NARA RG 15, Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, Texas, Travis County, Precinct No. 8, p. 1.
